{{DEFAULTSORT:Jumayyil, Ahmed}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian male actors]] [[Category:Maldivian male film actors]] [[Category:1989 births]]

{{short description|Maldivian actor}} {{Infobox person | name = Mohamed Jumayyil Nimal | image = Jumayyil GFA9.jpg | imagesize = | alt = | caption = Jumayyil at [[9th Gaumee Film Awards]] ceremony, 2019 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=y|1989|4|19}} | birth_place = [[Malé]] | nationality = Maldivian | alma_mater = | occupation = Actor | yearsactive = 2014–present | spouse = | children = | works = | awards = }} '''Mohamed Jumayyil Nimal''' (born 19 April 1989) is a Maldivian actor. He has established a career in Maldives Film Industry and is a recipient of several awards, including two [[Gaumee Film Awards]].
Born in [[Malé]], Jumayyil, the son of the renowned Maldivian film actor and director [[Ahmed Nimal]]. After completing his education, Nimal encouraged him to consider a career in the film industry and offered him to play a role in his family drama ''[[Aniyaa]]'', which earned him a [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Male Debut]]. Subsequently, he caught the attention of [[Dark Rain Entertainment]], leading to significant roles in their romantic films including ''[[Emme Fahu Vindha Jehendhen]]'' (2015) and [[Vaashey Mashaa Ekee]] (2016), both of which secured him nominations for the [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor]], ultimately winning the award for the latter.
Jumayyil's collaboration with [[Dark Rain Entertainment]] continued with a series of romantic comedies, including ''[[Mee Loaybakee]]'' (2017) and ''[[Vakin Loabin]]'' (2018). He later diversified his repertoire by exploring different genres including the crime thriller ''[[Goh Raalhu]]'' (2019), anthology crime web series ''[[Hatharu Halha]]'' and the comedy film ''[[Maamui]]'' (2019). Following controversies related to his personal life, he had experienced changes in his project lineup, with limited film releases.
==Early life== Mohamed Jumayyil's father [[Ahmed Nimal]] is a prominent figure in the film industry, known for his work as an actor and director.<ref name=football/> Jumayyil went to [[Ahmadhiyya International School|Ahmadiyya Pre-school]] as his first institution and continued his primary education at Jamaluddin School. His secondary education was completed at [[Dharumavantha School]].<ref name=football>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/arts/291732/ |title=Former Football Player, Now a talented actor |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Maahaa, Aishath |date=26 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610085522/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/arts/291732/ |archivedate=10 June 2016 |accessdate=10 June 2016}}</ref> Following the successful completion of his [[GCE Ordinary Level]] exams, Jumayyil's interest in pursuing a career in the film industry was nurtured by his father, Nimal.<ref name=football/> Recognizing Jumayyil's passion for acting, Nimal provided him with an opportunity to participate in one of the films he directed.<ref name=football/> During this period, he was a football player at [[B.G. Sports Club]].<ref name=football/> He also worked at [[Singapore Airlines Cargo]], before shifting his job and working as an [[Airport check-in]] staff.<ref name=football/>
==Career== ===2014–18: ''Vaashey Mashaa Ekee'' and romantic roles=== In 2014, Jumayyil made his film debut in [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s ''[[Aniyaa]]'', where he appeared alongside [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Ismail Rasheed]] and [[Fathimath Fareela]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://addulive.com/05113572013 |title=Jumayyyil is being launched to the industry with "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Addu Live |author=Faisal, Ibrahim |date=4 May 2013 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref><ref name="first release">{{cite news|url=http://vnews.mv/18164 |title=First release of the year "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Vnews |author=Ali, Safoora |date=29 March 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609172231/http://vnews.mv/18164 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> The film failed to generate much hype during its screening and received mixed-to-positive reviews from critics, achieving moderate success at the box office.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/276537/ |title="Aniyaa" and "Ran Dhari" released |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Naail, Ismail |date=25 May 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609171910/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/276537/ |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/2873 |title=Posters of "Emme Fahu Vindhaa Jehendhen"not upto mark |language=Divehi|publisher=Avas |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=9 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609172519/https://avas.mv/2873 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref>
[[File:Jumayyil Silver Jubilee.jpg|thumb|left|upright=0.9|Jumayyil at [[Niuma Mohamed]]'s Silver Jubilee celebration event, 2019]]
The subsequent year, Jumayyil appeared in [[Ali Shifau]]-directed romantic film ''[[Emme Fahu Vindha Jehendhen]]'' opposite [[Mariyam Majudha]], where he portrayed the role of Ryan.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/254622/ |title="Emme Fahu Vindhaa Jehendhen": A big success with repeat audience |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Naail, Ismail |date=7 April 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610083108/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/254622/ |archivedate=10 June 2016 |accessdate=10 June 2016}}</ref> The film received critical acclaim for its "engaging storyline", with Jumayyil's performance also earning positive feedback. In a pre-premiere review featured in ''Vaguthu'', Ismail Nail lauded the on-screen chemistry between Jumayyil and Majudha and noted significant improvements in Jumayyil's acting compared to his previous work in ''[[Aniyaa]]''.<ref name="EFVJ review">{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/review/253783/ |title=Pre-premiere Review: "Emme Fahu Vindhaa Jehendhen" A new benchmark to romantic films |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Naail, Ismail |date=5 April 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610083407/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/review/253783/ |archivedate=10 June 2016 |accessdate=10 June 2016}}</ref> The film was the highest-grossing Maldivian release of the year.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/255964/ |title=Unlimited compliments for "Emme Fahu Vindhaa Jehendhen" |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Naail, Ismail |date=10 April 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610083616/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/255964/ |archivedate=10 June 2016 |accessdate=10 June 2016}}</ref>
Jumayyil next starred in [[Ali Shifau]]-directed romantic comedy ''[[Vaashey Mashaa Ekee]]'' (2016) opposite [[Mariyam Majudha]]. In the film, he played the role of Ziyad, a carefree person with a very different personality compared to his partner.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.avas.mv/12504 |title=A new Film, A new Lover, A new Jumayyil |language=Divehi|publisher=Avas |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=8 January 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609164655/https://www.avas.mv/12504 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> His performance garnered positive reviews, with Ahmed Nadheem from ''Avas'' noting significant improvement in Jumayyil's acting compared to his previous work. Nadheem even rated Jumayyil on par with Majudha, whom he considered the best actor in the film.<ref name="unlimited praise">{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/15516 |title=Vaashey Mashaa Ekee: Unlimited praise |language=Divehi|publisher=Avas |author=Nasheem, Ahmed |date=6 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606080851/https://avas.mv/15516|archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}}</ref> The film emerged as one of the highest-grossing films of the year.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/876 |title=Upcoming releases of the year|language=Divehi|publisher=Mihaaru |author=Adhushan, Ahmed |date=3 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606085206/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/876 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}}</ref> At the [[8th Gaumee Film Awards]] Jumayyil received the [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] award for his role in the film while also earning a nomination for his performance in ''Emme Fahu Vindha Jehendhen''.<ref name="GFA8win" /><ref name="GFA8nom" /> Additionally, he received the [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Male Debut|Best Male Debut]] award for his role in ''[[Aniyaa]]''.<ref name=GFA8win/>
Later in the same year, Jumayyil appeared in [[Fathimath Nahula]]'s horror film ''[[4426]]'', where he portrayed the charatcer Suja, a member of a group of friends trapped in a haunted house.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/13832 |title=This time its not a "Nahu-styled" film, A revelation |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=26 February 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330052428/https://avas.mv/13832 |url-status=live |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Upon its release, the film received mostly positive reviews from critics. Ahmed Nadheem of ''Avas'' praised the film as a "masterpiece" but found Jumayyil's performance to be "average" in his role.<ref name=4426review>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24396 |title=4426 is Nahula's mastepiece |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=21 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330060956/https://avas.mv/24396 |url-status=live |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> ''4426'' was declared as the highest-grossing Maldivian film of the year.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/25919 |title=25 Housefull shows of 4426 screened! Now screening the last few shows |language=Divehi|work=Avas |date=20 November 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330061815/https://avas.mv/25919 |url-status=live |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In 2017, Jumayyil's first release was the Ali Musthafa-directed family drama film ''[[Malikaa (film)|Malikaa]]'' in which he played the supportive boyfriend of the titular character.<ref name=malikaa>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11594 |title=Malika Releasing on March 2 |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=13 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326140615/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11594|archivedate=26 March 2018 |access-date=26 March 2018 }}</ref> Featuring Ismail Zahir, [[Nuzuhath Shuaib]], [[Fathimath Azifa]], [[Ahmed Asim]], [[Ali Azim]] and [[Neena Saleem]] in prominent roles, the film received mixed reviews from critics.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/29543 |title=Malikaa is not a copy of Bhaghban |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=14 February 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180417154858/https://avas.mv/29543 |archivedate=17 April 2018 |access-date=26 March 2018}}</ref> Ahmed Nadheem, reviewing for ''Avas'' criticised Jumayyil for "showing no improvement" from his previous film in terms of acting ability.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/30264 |title=Family's shadow being cast over Malika |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=4 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180417155710/https://avas.mv/30264 |archivedate=17 April 2018 |access-date=17 April 2018}}</ref> Despite low expectations from trade analysts, the film performed moderately well at the box office.<ref name="2017review">{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28542 |title=2017: Is it a successful year for the film industry? |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=31 December 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326162251/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28542 |archivedate=26 March 2018 |access-date=26 March 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/29805 |title=Malika is a commercial success, watch out for the red carpet |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=20 February 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180417155914/https://avas.mv/29805 |archivedate=17 April 2018 |access-date=17 April 2018}}</ref> He then starred alongside [[Mariyam Azza]] in the romantic comedy film ''[[Mee Loaybakee]]'', directed by [[Ali Shifau]].<ref name=meeloaybakee>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/15378 |title=Dark Rain's Mee Laoybakee premiering tonight |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=4 April 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326150652/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/15378 |archivedate=26 March 2018 |accessdate=26 March 2018}}</ref> The film became one of the highest-grossing Maldivian films of 2017.<ref name="2017review"/><ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/36883 |title="Naughty 40": A mixture of all tastes |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Maaha |first=Aishath|date=6 August 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180327033332/https://avas.mv/36883 |url-status=live |archivedate=27 March 2018 |accessdate=27 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The following year, Jumayyil appeared in [[Ali Shifau]]'s family drama ''[[Vakin Loabin]]'' (2018), marking his second collaboration with [[Nuzuhath Shuaib]] and his third collaboration with [[Mariyam Majudha]].<ref name=commenced>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/21770 |title=Shooting of "Vakin Loabin" commenced |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=9 August 2017 |accessdate=12 September 2018}}</ref> The film explores the impact of a young couple's divorce on those around them.<ref name=filming>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/26222 |title=Shooting of "Vakin Loabin" completed |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=6 November 2017}}</ref> Upon its release, received positive reviews from critics, particularly for its toned-down melodrama and departure from genre stereotypes.<ref name=VakinLoabinReview/> In a pre-premiere review by Raajje.mv, Ismail Naail Nasheed praised the character development and reduced melodrama in the film, highlighting Jumayyil's versatility in portraying a range of emotions.<ref name=VakinLoabinReview>{{cite news |url=https://raajje.mv/news/27939 |title=Pre-premiere review of Vakin Loabin: A break apart from a genre of melodrama; A must watch |language=Divehi |work=Raajje.mv |last=Nasheed |first=Ismail Naail |date=4 March 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918062119/https://raajje.mv/news/27939 |url-status=dead |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
===2019–present: Experiment with different genres=== Jumayyil's first release in 2019 was the Ahmed Sinan-directed crime thriller ''[[Goh Raalhu]]'' (2019) which delves into themes of criminality and misdemeanors as a young man strives to prove the sincerity of his love.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/32989 |title=Goh Raalhu yet again postponed |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=20 March 2018 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20190128101708/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/32989 |url-status=live |archivedate=28 January 2019 |accessdate=28 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/14230 |title=Goh Raalhu: Shinan's second direction |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=13 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20190128074915/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/14230 |url-status=live |archivedate=28 January 2019 |accessdate=28 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> It received widespread positive reviews from critics, with Aminath Luba of ''Sun'' describing it as a "five-star worthy blockbuster film" and wrote: "Jumayyil yet again proved that he is here to stay and entertain the audience with his authentic performance, no matter what the genre is".<ref name=GohRaalhuReview>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/115066 |title=Goh Raalhu Review: Drowned in the wave of Goh Raalhu |language=Divehi |work=Sun |last=Luba |first=Aminath |date=16 February 2019 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20190523164142/https://sun.mv/115066 |url-status=live |archivedate=23 May 2019 |accessdate=23 May 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Furthermore, some reviews also suggested that he excels in crime-related roles over romantic ones.<ref name=GohRaalhuReview/> This was followed by his appearance as a conflicted husband and son in [[Ali Shifau]]-directed comedy film ''[[Maamui]]''.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/35536 |title=Filming for Maamui started with Ismail Wajeeh |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=7 May 2018 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20190401184238/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/35536 |url-status=live |archivedate=1 April 2019 |accessdate=1 April 2019 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Upon its release, the film received mainly positive reviews from critics, while Jumayyil's performance was perceived by critics as "good but nothing great". Ifraz Ali from ''Dho?'' found the dialogue delivery by Jumayyil to be "unrealistic" in the film.<ref name=MaamuiRev>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/121565 |title=Maamui Review: A honey-filled laughing riot |language=Divehi |work=Sun |last=Lubaa |first=Aminath |date=11 July 2019 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20231001105610/https://sun.mv/121565 |archivedate=1 October 2023 |access-date=1 October 2023}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/57885 |title=This Maamui tastes good |language=Divehi |work=Dho? |last=Ali |first=Ifraz |date=16 July 2019 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20231001111817/https://dho.mv/baiscope/57885 |archivedate=1 October 2023 |access-date=1 October 2023}}</ref> Later in the year, the first Maldivian [[Anthology film|anthology]] film was released, featuring Jumayyil as a drug dealer in the segment directed by [[Ravee Farooq]], titled ''Gaathil''.<ref name=HHInt>{{cite news |url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/62002 |title=After a six years' gap, Hatharu Halha to release in Baiskoafu |work=Mihaaru |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=29 September 2020 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200910180054/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/62002 |url-status=live |archivedate=10 September 2020 |accessdate=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> This project, shot in 2013, was digitally released six years later due to post-production delays.<ref name=HHcont>{{cite news |url=https://avas.mv/14072 |title=Ravee on Hot seat in Hatharu Halha project |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=4 March 2016 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200911091728/https://avas.mv/14072 |url-status=live |archivedate=11 September 2020 |accessdate=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
Following controversies related to his personal life, Jumayyil experienced changes in his project lineup, with some roles being reassigned to other contemporary actors.<ref name=porn/> However, he was retained in certain films due to the progress of filming.<ref name=porn/> In 2023, Jumayyil appeared in [[Ilyas Waheed]]'s crime thriller ''[[Nina (2023 film)|Nina]]'' (2023), where he portrayed the character Zafar.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://dhuvas.mv/238046 |title=Dhivehi film "Neena" to release in August |work=Dhuvas |date=31 May 2023 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20230531102152/https://dhuvas.mv/238046 |url-status=live |archivedate=31 May 2023 |accessdate=12 August 2023 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Originally scheduled for a theatrical release in late 2020, the film was postponed due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic]].<ref name="COVID">{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/79793 |title=Release of Nina postponed due to COVID-19 |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=4 September 2020 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20210111123737/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/79793 |url-status=live|archivedate=11 January 2021 |accessdate=10 January 2021 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Upon its eventual release, the film received positive reviews from critics.<ref name=DhuvasNina/> Akram Abdulla of 'Dhauru' praised it as a thrilling experience with commendable performances, offering an excellent cinematic experience to viewers.<ref name=DhuvasNina>{{cite news|url=https://dhauru.com/post/entertainment/20806 |title=Neena: A good film worth a watch |work=Dhauru |last=Abdulla |first=Akram |date=7 August 2023 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20230812094902/https://dhauru.com/post/entertainment/20806 |url-status=live |archivedate=12 August 2023 |accessdate=12 August 2023 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Media image== In 2018, he was ranked in the ninth position from Dho?'s list of Top Ten Actor of Maldives.<ref name=BestActor>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |title=Who is the Best Actor? |work=Dho? |language=dv |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=26 February 2018 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190106182050/https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |url-status=live |archive-date=6 January 2019 |access-date=7 February 2019|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Controversy== In December 2016, Jumayyil was under investigation on allegations of raping two of his female relatives.<ref name=porn/> The Prosecutor General's Office revealed that charges of sexual assault were not pressed against him as a result of insufficient evidence.<ref name=evidence>{{cite news|url=https://edition.mv/news/17646 |title=Actor Jumayyil prosecuted for keeping porn on phone, tablet |work=The Edition |last=Malsa |first=Mariyam |date=3 July 2020 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20200705043948/https://edition.mv/news/17646 |url-status=live |archivedate=5 July 2020 |accessdate=5 July 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Allegations regarding the sexual abuse resurfaced in July 2020 after one of the victim, aged 17 at the time of the abuse, publicly shared a detailed account of the harassment.<ref name=evidence/> As a result, production company [[Dark Rain Entertainment]] removed him from all pending projects.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://raajje.mv/81873 |title=Maldivian actor accused of rape, dropped from all pending projects |work=Raajje.mv |last=Zalif |first=Zunana |date=3 July 2020 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200820110753/https://raajje.mv/81873 |url-status=live |archivedate=20 August 2020 |accessdate=20 August 2020 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
On 18 December 2017, a case was filed against Jumayyil at Criminal Court for keeping pornographic material on his phone.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://en.sun.mv/48354 |title=Jumayyil charged with porn possession |work=Actor Jumayyil prosecuted for keeping porn on phone, tablet |date=18 April 2018 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200820105735/https://en.sun.mv/48354 |url-status=live |archivedate=20 August 2020 |accessdate=20 August 2020 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Three months later, he was charged with possession of pornography, however, was freed on bail when summoned to court for a remand hearing.<ref name=porn>{{cite news|url=https://maldivesindependent.com/crime-2/jumayyil-charged-with-porn-possession-137565 |title=Jumayyil charged with porn possession |work=Maldives Independent |date=18 April 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20200820104951/https://maldivesindependent.com/crime-2/jumayyil-charged-with-porn-possession-137565 |url-status=live |archivedate=20 August 2020 |accessdate=20 August 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> In January 2018, Jumayyil was arrested from a cafe in Malé on suspicion of consuming and possessing alcohol.<ref name=porn/>

===Television and web series=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2019 !scope="row"| ''[[Karu Hakuru]]'' | Himself | Guest role; Episode "Nubai Buri" and "Ten Ants" | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=KaruHakuru>{{cite news |url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/51680 |title=Lamha brings the require nuance to Karu Hakuru |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=14 March 2019 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20190813104116/https://dho.mv/baiscope/51680 |archivedate=13 August 2019 |accessdate=13 August 2019 |df=dmy-all |url-status=live }}</ref> |- | 2019 !scope="row"| ''[[Hatharu Halha]]'' | Katey | In the segment ''Gaathil'' | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=HHInt/> |- | 2019–2020 !scope="row"| ''[[Maayoos]]'' | Amir | Main role; 13 episodes | style="text-align: center;"|<ref name=Maayoos>{{cite news |url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/64450 |title=Maayoos to release in Baiskoafu |work=Mihaaru |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=11 November 2019 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200915065833/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/64450 |url-status=live |archivedate=15 September 2020 |accessdate=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> |- |}

==Accolades== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Award !scope="col"| Category !scope="col"| Nominated work !scope="col"| Result ! scope="col" class="unsortable"| {{Abbr|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- |rowspan="3"| 2017 ! scope="row" rowspan="3" | [[8th Gaumee Film Awards]] |rowspan="2"| [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] | ''[[Vaashey Mashaa Ekee]]'' | {{won}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=GFA8win>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28345 |title="Vaashey Mashaa Ekee" wins majority awards |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=20 December 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330182244/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28345 |url-status=live |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}}</ref> |- | ''[[Emme Fahu Vindha Jehendhen]]'' | {{nom}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=GFA8nom>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28015 |title=8th Gaumee Film Awards: Dark Rain leads nomination |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=12 December 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330160950/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28015 |url-status=live |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}}</ref> |- | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Male Debut|Best Male Debut]] | ''[[Aniyaa]]'' | {{won}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=GFA8win/> |- | 2019 ! scope="row" | [[9th Gaumee Film Awards]] | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] | ''[[Vakin Loabin]]'' | {{nom}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=GFA9nom>{{cite news |url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/64429 |title=Nominations for 9th Dhivehi Film Awards |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=9 November 2019 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200824150459/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/64429 |url-status=live |archivedate=24 August 2020 |accessdate=24 August 2020 }}</ref> |- |}

{{short description|Maldivian actor}} {{Infobox person | name = Mohamed Jumayyil Nimal | image = Jumayyil GFA9.jpg | imagesize = | alt = | caption = Jumayyil at [[9th Gaumee Film Awards]] ceremony, 2019 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=y|1989|4|19}} | birth_place = [[Malé]] | nationality = Maldivian | alma_mater = | occupation = Actor | yearsactive = 2014–present | spouse = | children = | works = | awards = }} '''Mohamed Jumayyil Nimal''' (born 19 April 1989) is a Maldivian actor. He has established a career in Maldives Film Industry and is a recipient of several awards, including two [[Gaumee Film Awards]].
Born in [[Malé]], Jumayyil is the son of the renowned Maldivian film actor and director [[Ahmed Nimal]]. After completing his education, Nimal encouraged him to consider a career in the film industry and offered him to play a role in his family drama ''[[Aniyaa]]'', which earned him a [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Male Debut]]. Subsequently, he caught the attention of [[Dark Rain Entertainment]], leading to significant roles in their romantic films including ''[[Emme Fahu Vindha Jehendhen]]'' (2015) and [[Vaashey Mashaa Ekee]] (2016), both of which secured him nominations for the [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor]], ultimately winning the award for the latter.
Jumayyil's collaboration with [[Dark Rain Entertainment]] continued with a series of romantic comedies, including ''[[Mee Loaybakee]]'' (2017) and ''[[Vakin Loabin]]'' (2018). He later diversified his repertoire by exploring different genres including the crime thriller ''[[Goh Raalhu]]'' (2019), anthology crime web series ''[[Hatharu Halha]]'' and the comedy film ''[[Maamui]]'' (2019). Following controversies related to his personal life, he had experienced changes in his project lineup, with limited film releases.
==Early life== Mohamed Jumayyil's father [[Ahmed Nimal]] is a prominent figure in the film industry, known for his work as an actor and director.<ref name=football/> Jumayyil went to [[Ahmadhiyya International School|Ahmadiyya Pre-school]] as his first institution and continued his primary education at Jamaluddin School. His secondary education was completed at [[Dharumavantha School]].<ref name=football>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/arts/291732/ |title=Former Football Player, Now a talented actor |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Maahaa, Aishath |date=26 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610085522/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/arts/291732/ |archivedate=10 June 2016 |accessdate=10 June 2016}}</ref> Following the successful completion of his [[GCE Ordinary Level]] exams, Jumayyil's interest in pursuing a career in the film industry was nurtured by his father, Nimal.<ref name=football/> Recognizing Jumayyil's passion for acting, Nimal provided him with an opportunity to participate in one of the films he directed.<ref name=football/> During this period, he was a football player at [[B.G. Sports Club]].<ref name=football/> He also worked at [[Singapore Airlines Cargo]], before shifting his job and working as an [[Airport check-in]] staff.<ref name=football/>
==Career== ===2014–18: ''Vaashey Mashaa Ekee'' and romantic roles=== In 2014, Jumayyil made his film debut in [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s ''[[Aniyaa]]'', where he appeared alongside [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Ismail Rasheed]] and [[Fathimath Fareela]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://addulive.com/05113572013 |title=Jumayyyil is being launched to the industry with "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Addu Live |author=Faisal, Ibrahim |date=4 May 2013 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref><ref name="first release">{{cite news|url=http://vnews.mv/18164 |title=First release of the year "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Vnews |author=Ali, Safoora |date=29 March 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609172231/http://vnews.mv/18164 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> The film failed to generate much hype during its screening and received mixed-to-positive reviews from critics, achieving moderate success at the box office.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/276537/ |title="Aniyaa" and "Ran Dhari" released |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Naail, Ismail |date=25 May 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609171910/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/276537/ |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/2873 |title=Posters of "Emme Fahu Vindhaa Jehendhen"not upto mark |language=Divehi|publisher=Avas |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=9 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609172519/https://avas.mv/2873 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref>
[[File:Jumayyil Silver Jubilee.jpg|thumb|left|upright=0.9|Jumayyil at [[Niuma Mohamed]]'s Silver Jubilee celebration event, 2019]]
The subsequent year, Jumayyil appeared in [[Ali Shifau]]-directed romantic film ''[[Emme Fahu Vindha Jehendhen]]'' opposite [[Mariyam Majudha]], where he portrayed the role of Ryan.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/254622/ |title="Emme Fahu Vindhaa Jehendhen": A big success with repeat audience |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Naail, Ismail |date=7 April 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610083108/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/254622/ |archivedate=10 June 2016 |accessdate=10 June 2016}}</ref> The film received critical acclaim for its "engaging storyline", with Jumayyil's performance also earning positive feedback. In a pre-premiere review featured in ''Vaguthu'', Ismail Nail lauded the on-screen chemistry between Jumayyil and Majudha and noted significant improvements in Jumayyil's acting compared to his previous work in ''[[Aniyaa]]''.<ref name="EFVJ review">{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/review/253783/ |title=Pre-premiere Review: "Emme Fahu Vindhaa Jehendhen" A new benchmark to romantic films |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Naail, Ismail |date=5 April 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610083407/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/review/253783/ |archivedate=10 June 2016 |accessdate=10 June 2016}}</ref> The film was the highest-grossing Maldivian release of the year.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/255964/ |title=Unlimited compliments for "Emme Fahu Vindhaa Jehendhen" |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Naail, Ismail |date=10 April 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610083616/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/255964/ |archivedate=10 June 2016 |accessdate=10 June 2016}}</ref>
Jumayyil next starred in [[Ali Shifau]]-directed romantic comedy ''[[Vaashey Mashaa Ekee]]'' (2016) opposite [[Mariyam Majudha]]. In the film, he played the role of Ziyad, a carefree person with a very different personality compared to his partner.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.avas.mv/12504 |title=A new Film, A new Lover, A new Jumayyil |language=Divehi|publisher=Avas |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=8 January 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609164655/https://www.avas.mv/12504 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> His performance garnered positive reviews, with Ahmed Nadheem from ''Avas'' noting significant improvement in Jumayyil's acting compared to his previous work. Nadheem even rated Jumayyil on par with Majudha, whom he considered the best actor in the film.<ref name="unlimited praise">{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/15516 |title=Vaashey Mashaa Ekee: Unlimited praise |language=Divehi|publisher=Avas |author=Nasheem, Ahmed |date=6 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606080851/https://avas.mv/15516|archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}}</ref> The film emerged as one of the highest-grossing films of the year.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/876 |title=Upcoming releases of the year|language=Divehi|publisher=Mihaaru |author=Adhushan, Ahmed |date=3 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606085206/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/876 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}}</ref> At the [[8th Gaumee Film Awards]] Jumayyil received the [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] award for his role in the film while also earning a nomination for his performance in ''Emme Fahu Vindha Jehendhen''.<ref name="GFA8win" /><ref name="GFA8nom" /> Additionally, he received the [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Male Debut|Best Male Debut]] award for his role in ''[[Aniyaa]]''.<ref name=GFA8win/>
Later in the same year, Jumayyil appeared in [[Fathimath Nahula]]'s horror film ''[[4426]]'', where he portrayed the charatcer Suja, a member of a group of friends trapped in a haunted house.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/13832 |title=This time its not a "Nahu-styled" film, A revelation |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=26 February 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330052428/https://avas.mv/13832 |url-status=live |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Upon its release, the film received mostly positive reviews from critics. Ahmed Nadheem of ''Avas'' praised the film as a "masterpiece" but found Jumayyil's performance to be "average" in his role.<ref name=4426review>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24396 |title=4426 is Nahula's mastepiece |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=21 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330060956/https://avas.mv/24396 |url-status=live |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> ''4426'' was declared as the highest-grossing Maldivian film of the year.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/25919 |title=25 Housefull shows of 4426 screened! Now screening the last few shows |language=Divehi|work=Avas |date=20 November 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330061815/https://avas.mv/25919 |url-status=live |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In 2017, Jumayyil's first release was the Ali Musthafa-directed family drama film ''[[Malikaa (film)|Malikaa]]'' in which he played the supportive boyfriend of the titular character.<ref name=malikaa>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11594 |title=Malika Releasing on March 2 |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=13 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326140615/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11594|archivedate=26 March 2018 |access-date=26 March 2018 }}</ref> Featuring Ismail Zahir, [[Nuzuhath Shuaib]], [[Fathimath Azifa]], [[Ahmed Asim]], [[Ali Azim]] and [[Neena Saleem]] in prominent roles, the film received mixed reviews from critics.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/29543 |title=Malikaa is not a copy of Bhaghban |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=14 February 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180417154858/https://avas.mv/29543 |archivedate=17 April 2018 |access-date=26 March 2018}}</ref> Ahmed Nadheem, reviewing for ''Avas'' criticised Jumayyil for "showing no improvement" from his previous film in terms of acting ability.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/30264 |title=Family's shadow being cast over Malika |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=4 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180417155710/https://avas.mv/30264 |archivedate=17 April 2018 |access-date=17 April 2018}}</ref> Despite low expectations from trade analysts, the film performed moderately well at the box office.<ref name="2017review">{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28542 |title=2017: Is it a successful year for the film industry? |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=31 December 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326162251/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28542 |archivedate=26 March 2018 |access-date=26 March 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/29805 |title=Malika is a commercial success, watch out for the red carpet |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=20 February 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180417155914/https://avas.mv/29805 |archivedate=17 April 2018 |access-date=17 April 2018}}</ref> He then starred alongside [[Mariyam Azza]] in the romantic comedy film ''[[Mee Loaybakee]]'', directed by [[Ali Shifau]].<ref name=meeloaybakee>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/15378 |title=Dark Rain's Mee Laoybakee premiering tonight |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=4 April 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326150652/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/15378 |archivedate=26 March 2018 |accessdate=26 March 2018}}</ref> The film became one of the highest-grossing Maldivian films of 2017.<ref name="2017review"/><ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/36883 |title="Naughty 40": A mixture of all tastes |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Maaha |first=Aishath|date=6 August 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180327033332/https://avas.mv/36883 |url-status=live |archivedate=27 March 2018 |accessdate=27 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The following year, Jumayyil appeared in [[Ali Shifau]]'s family drama ''[[Vakin Loabin]]'' (2018), marking his second collaboration with [[Nuzuhath Shuaib]] and his third collaboration with [[Mariyam Majudha]].<ref name=commenced>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/21770 |title=Shooting of "Vakin Loabin" commenced |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=9 August 2017 |accessdate=12 September 2018}}</ref> The film explores the impact of a young couple's divorce on those around them.<ref name=filming>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/26222 |title=Shooting of "Vakin Loabin" completed |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=6 November 2017}}</ref> Upon its release, received positive reviews from critics, particularly for its toned-down melodrama and departure from genre stereotypes.<ref name=VakinLoabinReview/> In a pre-premiere review by Raajje.mv, Ismail Naail Nasheed praised the character development and reduced melodrama in the film, highlighting Jumayyil's versatility in portraying a range of emotions.<ref name=VakinLoabinReview>{{cite news |url=https://raajje.mv/news/27939 |title=Pre-premiere review of Vakin Loabin: A break apart from a genre of melodrama; A must watch |language=Divehi |work=Raajje.mv |last=Nasheed |first=Ismail Naail |date=4 March 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918062119/https://raajje.mv/news/27939 |url-status=dead |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
===2019–present: Experiment with different genres=== Jumayyil's first release in 2019 was the Ahmed Sinan-directed crime thriller ''[[Goh Raalhu]]'' (2019) which delves into themes of criminality and misdemeanors as a young man strives to prove the sincerity of his love.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/32989 |title=Goh Raalhu yet again postponed |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=20 March 2018 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20190128101708/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/32989 |url-status=live |archivedate=28 January 2019 |accessdate=28 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/14230 |title=Goh Raalhu: Shinan's second direction |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=13 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20190128074915/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/14230 |url-status=live |archivedate=28 January 2019 |accessdate=28 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> It received widespread positive reviews from critics, with Aminath Luba of ''Sun'' describing it as a "five-star worthy blockbuster film" and wrote: "Jumayyil yet again proved that he is here to stay and entertain the audience with his authentic performance, no matter what the genre is".<ref name=GohRaalhuReview>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/115066 |title=Goh Raalhu Review: Drowned in the wave of Goh Raalhu |language=Divehi |work=Sun |last=Luba |first=Aminath |date=16 February 2019 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20190523164142/https://sun.mv/115066 |url-status=live |archivedate=23 May 2019 |accessdate=23 May 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Furthermore, some reviews also suggested that he excels in crime-related roles over romantic ones.<ref name=GohRaalhuReview/> This was followed by his appearance as a conflicted husband and son in [[Ali Shifau]]-directed comedy film ''[[Maamui]]''.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/35536 |title=Filming for Maamui started with Ismail Wajeeh |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=7 May 2018 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20190401184238/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/35536 |url-status=live |archivedate=1 April 2019 |accessdate=1 April 2019 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Upon its release, the film received mainly positive reviews from critics, while Jumayyil's performance was perceived by critics as "good but nothing great". Ifraz Ali from ''Dho?'' found the dialogue delivery by Jumayyil to be "unrealistic" in the film.<ref name=MaamuiRev>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/121565 |title=Maamui Review: A honey-filled laughing riot |language=Divehi |work=Sun |last=Lubaa |first=Aminath |date=11 July 2019 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20231001105610/https://sun.mv/121565 |archivedate=1 October 2023 |access-date=1 October 2023}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/57885 |title=This Maamui tastes good |language=Divehi |work=Dho? |last=Ali |first=Ifraz |date=16 July 2019 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20231001111817/https://dho.mv/baiscope/57885 |archivedate=1 October 2023 |access-date=1 October 2023}}</ref> Later in the year, the first Maldivian [[Anthology film|anthology]] film was released, featuring Jumayyil as a drug dealer in the segment directed by [[Ravee Farooq]], titled ''Gaathil''.<ref name=HHInt>{{cite news |url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/62002 |title=After a six years' gap, Hatharu Halha to release in Baiskoafu |work=Mihaaru |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=29 September 2020 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200910180054/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/62002 |url-status=live |archivedate=10 September 2020 |accessdate=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> This project, shot in 2013, was digitally released six years later due to post-production delays.<ref name=HHcont>{{cite news |url=https://avas.mv/14072 |title=Ravee on Hot seat in Hatharu Halha project |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=4 March 2016 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200911091728/https://avas.mv/14072 |url-status=live |archivedate=11 September 2020 |accessdate=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
Following controversies related to his personal life, Jumayyil experienced changes in his project lineup, with some roles being reassigned to other contemporary actors.<ref name=porn/> However, he was retained in certain films due to the progress of filming.<ref name=porn/> In 2023, Jumayyil appeared in [[Ilyas Waheed]]'s crime thriller ''[[Nina (2023 film)|Nina]]'' (2023), where he portrayed the character Zafar.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://dhuvas.mv/238046 |title=Dhivehi film "Neena" to release in August |work=Dhuvas |date=31 May 2023 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20230531102152/https://dhuvas.mv/238046 |url-status=live |archivedate=31 May 2023 |accessdate=12 August 2023 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Originally scheduled for a theatrical release in late 2020, the film was postponed due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic]].<ref name="COVID">{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/79793 |title=Release of Nina postponed due to COVID-19 |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=4 September 2020 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20210111123737/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/79793 |url-status=live|archivedate=11 January 2021 |accessdate=10 January 2021 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Upon its eventual release, the film received positive reviews from critics.<ref name=DhuvasNina/> Akram Abdulla of 'Dhauru' praised it as a thrilling experience with commendable performances, offering an excellent cinematic experience to viewers.<ref name=DhuvasNina>{{cite news|url=https://dhauru.com/post/entertainment/20806 |title=Neena: A good film worth a watch |work=Dhauru |last=Abdulla |first=Akram |date=7 August 2023 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20230812094902/https://dhauru.com/post/entertainment/20806 |url-status=live |archivedate=12 August 2023 |accessdate=12 August 2023 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Media image== In 2018, he was ranked in the ninth position from Dho?'s list of Top Ten Actor of Maldives.<ref name=BestActor>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |title=Who is the Best Actor? |work=Dho? |language=dv |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=26 February 2018 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190106182050/https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |url-status=live |archive-date=6 January 2019 |access-date=7 February 2019|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Controversy== In December 2016, Jumayyil was under investigation on allegations of raping two of his female relatives.<ref name=porn/> The Prosecutor General's Office revealed that charges of sexual assault were not pressed against him as a result of insufficient evidence.<ref name=evidence>{{cite news|url=https://edition.mv/news/17646 |title=Actor Jumayyil prosecuted for keeping porn on phone, tablet |work=The Edition |last=Malsa |first=Mariyam |date=3 July 2020 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20200705043948/https://edition.mv/news/17646 |url-status=live |archivedate=5 July 2020 |accessdate=5 July 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Allegations regarding the sexual abuse resurfaced in July 2020 after one of the victim, aged 17 at the time of the abuse, publicly shared a detailed account of the harassment.<ref name=evidence/> As a result, production company [[Dark Rain Entertainment]] removed him from all pending projects.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://raajje.mv/81873 |title=Maldivian actor accused of rape, dropped from all pending projects |work=Raajje.mv |last=Zalif |first=Zunana |date=3 July 2020 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200820110753/https://raajje.mv/81873 |url-status=live |archivedate=20 August 2020 |accessdate=20 August 2020 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
On 18 December 2017, a case was filed against Jumayyil at Criminal Court for keeping pornographic material on his phone.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://en.sun.mv/48354 |title=Jumayyil charged with porn possession |work=Actor Jumayyil prosecuted for keeping porn on phone, tablet |date=18 April 2018 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200820105735/https://en.sun.mv/48354 |url-status=live |archivedate=20 August 2020 |accessdate=20 August 2020 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Three months later, he was charged with possession of pornography, however, was freed on bail when summoned to court for a remand hearing.<ref name=porn>{{cite news|url=https://maldivesindependent.com/crime-2/jumayyil-charged-with-porn-possession-137565 |title=Jumayyil charged with porn possession |work=Maldives Independent |date=18 April 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20200820104951/https://maldivesindependent.com/crime-2/jumayyil-charged-with-porn-possession-137565 |url-status=live |archivedate=20 August 2020 |accessdate=20 August 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> In January 2018, Jumayyil was arrested from a cafe in Malé on suspicion of consuming and possessing alcohol.<ref name=porn/>

{{DEFAULTSORT:Jumayyil, Ahmed}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian male actors]] [[Category:Maldivian male film actors]] [[Category:1989 births]]

{{short description|Maldivian actor}} {{Infobox person | name = Mohamed Jumayyil Nimal | image = Jumayyil GFA9.jpg | imagesize = | alt = | caption = Jumayyil at [[9th Gaumee Film Awards]] ceremony, 2019 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=y|1989|4|19}} | birth_place = [[Malé]] | nationality = Maldivian | alma_mater = | occupation = Actor | yearsactive = 2014–present | spouse = | children = | works = | awards = }} '''Mohamed Jumayyil Nimal''' (born 19 April 1989) is a Maldivian actor. He has established a career in Maldives Film Industry and is a recipient of several awards, including two [[Gaumee Film Awards]].
Born in [[Malé]], Jumayyil is the son of the renowned Maldivian film actor and director [[Ahmed Nimal]]. After completing his education, Nimal encouraged him to consider a career in the film industry and offered him to play a role in his family drama ''[[Aniyaa]]'', which earned him a [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Male Debut]]. Subsequently, he caught the attention of [[Dark Rain Entertainment]], leading to significant roles in their romantic films including ''[[Emme Fahu Vindha Jehendhen]]'' (2015) and [[Vaashey Mashaa Ekee]] (2016), both of which secured him nominations for the [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor]], ultimately winning the award for the latter.
Jumayyil's collaboration with [[Dark Rain Entertainment]] continued with a series of romantic comedies, including ''[[Mee Loaybakee]]'' (2017) and ''[[Vakin Loabin]]'' (2018). He later diversified his repertoire by exploring different genres including the crime thriller ''[[Goh Raalhu]]'' (2019), anthology crime web series ''[[Hatharu Halha]]'' and the comedy film ''[[Maamui]]'' (2019). Following controversies related to his personal life, he had experienced changes in his project lineup, with limited film releases.
==Early life== Mohamed Jumayyil's father [[Ahmed Nimal]] is a prominent figure in the film industry, known for his work as an actor and director.<ref name=football/> Jumayyil went to [[Ahmadhiyya International School|Ahmadiyya Pre-school]] as his first institution and continued his primary education at Jamaluddin School. His secondary education was completed at [[Dharumavantha School]].<ref name=football>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/arts/291732/ |title=Former Football Player, Now a talented actor |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Maahaa, Aishath |date=26 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610085522/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/arts/291732/ |archivedate=10 June 2016 |accessdate=10 June 2016}}</ref> Following the successful completion of his [[GCE Ordinary Level]] exams, Jumayyil's interest in pursuing a career in the film industry was nurtured by his father, Nimal.<ref name=football/> Recognizing Jumayyil's passion for acting, Nimal provided him with an opportunity to participate in one of the films he directed.<ref name=football/> During this period, he was a football player at [[B.G. Sports Club]].<ref name=football/> He also worked at [[Singapore Airlines Cargo]], before shifting his job and working as an [[Airport check-in]] staff.<ref name=football/>
==Career== ===2014–18: ''Vaashey Mashaa Ekee'' and romantic roles=== In 2014, Jumayyil made his film debut in [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s ''[[Aniyaa]]'', where he appeared alongside [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Ismail Rasheed]] and [[Fathimath Fareela]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://addulive.com/05113572013 |title=Jumayyyil is being launched to the industry with "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Addu Live |author=Faisal, Ibrahim |date=4 May 2013 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref><ref name="first release">{{cite news|url=http://vnews.mv/18164 |title=First release of the year "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Vnews |author=Ali, Safoora |date=29 March 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609172231/http://vnews.mv/18164 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> The film failed to generate much hype during its screening and received mixed-to-positive reviews from critics, achieving moderate success at the box office.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/276537/ |title="Aniyaa" and "Ran Dhari" released |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Naail, Ismail |date=25 May 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609171910/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/276537/ |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/2873 |title=Posters of "Emme Fahu Vindhaa Jehendhen"not upto mark |language=Divehi|publisher=Avas |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=9 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609172519/https://avas.mv/2873 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref>
[[File:Jumayyil Silver Jubilee.jpg|thumb|left|upright=0.9|Jumayyil at [[Niuma Mohamed]]'s Silver Jubilee celebration event, 2019]]
The subsequent year, Jumayyil appeared in [[Ali Shifau]]-directed romantic film ''[[Emme Fahu Vindha Jehendhen]]'' opposite [[Mariyam Majudha]], where he portrayed the role of Ryan.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/254622/ |title="Emme Fahu Vindhaa Jehendhen": A big success with repeat audience |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Naail, Ismail |date=7 April 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610083108/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/254622/ |archivedate=10 June 2016 |accessdate=10 June 2016}}</ref> The film received critical acclaim for its "engaging storyline", with Jumayyil's performance also earning positive feedback. In a pre-premiere review featured in ''Vaguthu'', Ismail Nail lauded the on-screen chemistry between Jumayyil and Majudha and noted significant improvements in Jumayyil's acting compared to his previous work in ''[[Aniyaa]]''.<ref name="EFVJ review">{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/review/253783/ |title=Pre-premiere Review: "Emme Fahu Vindhaa Jehendhen" A new benchmark to romantic films |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Naail, Ismail |date=5 April 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610083407/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/review/253783/ |archivedate=10 June 2016 |accessdate=10 June 2016}}</ref> The film was the highest-grossing Maldivian release of the year.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/255964/ |title=Unlimited compliments for "Emme Fahu Vindhaa Jehendhen" |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Naail, Ismail |date=10 April 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610083616/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/maldives-film-industry/255964/ |archivedate=10 June 2016 |accessdate=10 June 2016}}</ref>
Jumayyil next starred in [[Ali Shifau]]-directed romantic comedy ''[[Vaashey Mashaa Ekee]]'' (2016) opposite [[Mariyam Majudha]]. In the film, he played the role of Ziyad, a carefree person with a very different personality compared to his partner.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.avas.mv/12504 |title=A new Film, A new Lover, A new Jumayyil |language=Divehi|publisher=Avas |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=8 January 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609164655/https://www.avas.mv/12504 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> His performance garnered positive reviews, with Ahmed Nadheem from ''Avas'' noting significant improvement in Jumayyil's acting compared to his previous work. Nadheem even rated Jumayyil on par with Majudha, whom he considered the best actor in the film.<ref name="unlimited praise">{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/15516 |title=Vaashey Mashaa Ekee: Unlimited praise |language=Divehi|publisher=Avas |author=Nasheem, Ahmed |date=6 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606080851/https://avas.mv/15516|archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}}</ref> The film emerged as one of the highest-grossing films of the year.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/876 |title=Upcoming releases of the year|language=Divehi|publisher=Mihaaru |author=Adhushan, Ahmed |date=3 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606085206/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/876 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}}</ref> At the [[8th Gaumee Film Awards]] Jumayyil received the [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] award for his role in the film while also earning a nomination for his performance in ''Emme Fahu Vindha Jehendhen''.<ref name="GFA8win" /><ref name="GFA8nom" /> Additionally, he received the [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Male Debut|Best Male Debut]] award for his role in ''[[Aniyaa]]''.<ref name=GFA8win/>
Later in the same year, Jumayyil appeared in [[Fathimath Nahula]]'s horror film ''[[4426]]'', where he portrayed the charatcer Suja, a member of a group of friends trapped in a haunted house.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/13832 |title=This time its not a "Nahu-styled" film, A revelation |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=26 February 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330052428/https://avas.mv/13832 |url-status=live |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Upon its release, the film received mostly positive reviews from critics. Ahmed Nadheem of ''Avas'' praised the film as a "masterpiece" but found Jumayyil's performance to be "average" in his role.<ref name=4426review>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24396 |title=4426 is Nahula's mastepiece |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=21 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330060956/https://avas.mv/24396 |url-status=live |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> ''4426'' was declared as the highest-grossing Maldivian film of the year.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/25919 |title=25 Housefull shows of 4426 screened! Now screening the last few shows |language=Divehi|work=Avas |date=20 November 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330061815/https://avas.mv/25919 |url-status=live |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In 2017, Jumayyil's first release was the Ali Musthafa-directed family drama film ''[[Malikaa (film)|Malikaa]]'' in which he played the supportive boyfriend of the titular character.<ref name=malikaa>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11594 |title=Malika Releasing on March 2 |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=13 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326140615/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11594|archivedate=26 March 2018 |access-date=26 March 2018 }}</ref> Featuring Ismail Zahir, [[Nuzuhath Shuaib]], [[Fathimath Azifa]], [[Ahmed Asim]], [[Ali Azim]] and [[Neena Saleem]] in prominent roles, the film received mixed reviews from critics.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/29543 |title=Malikaa is not a copy of Bhaghban |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=14 February 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180417154858/https://avas.mv/29543 |archivedate=17 April 2018 |access-date=26 March 2018}}</ref> Ahmed Nadheem, reviewing for ''Avas'' criticised Jumayyil for "showing no improvement" from his previous film in terms of acting ability.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/30264 |title=Family's shadow being cast over Malika |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=4 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180417155710/https://avas.mv/30264 |archivedate=17 April 2018 |access-date=17 April 2018}}</ref> Despite low expectations from trade analysts, the film performed moderately well at the box office.<ref name="2017review">{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28542 |title=2017: Is it a successful year for the film industry? |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=31 December 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326162251/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28542 |archivedate=26 March 2018 |access-date=26 March 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/29805 |title=Malika is a commercial success, watch out for the red carpet |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=20 February 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180417155914/https://avas.mv/29805 |archivedate=17 April 2018 |access-date=17 April 2018}}</ref> He then starred alongside [[Mariyam Azza]] in the romantic comedy film ''[[Mee Loaybakee]]'', directed by [[Ali Shifau]].<ref name=meeloaybakee>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/15378 |title=Dark Rain's Mee Laoybakee premiering tonight |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=4 April 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326150652/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/15378 |archivedate=26 March 2018 |accessdate=26 March 2018}}</ref> The film became one of the highest-grossing Maldivian films of 2017.<ref name="2017review"/><ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/36883 |title="Naughty 40": A mixture of all tastes |language=Divehi|work=Avas |last=Maaha |first=Aishath|date=6 August 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180327033332/https://avas.mv/36883 |url-status=live |archivedate=27 March 2018 |accessdate=27 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The following year, Jumayyil appeared in [[Ali Shifau]]'s family drama ''[[Vakin Loabin]]'' (2018), marking his second collaboration with [[Nuzuhath Shuaib]] and his third collaboration with [[Mariyam Majudha]].<ref name=commenced>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/21770 |title=Shooting of "Vakin Loabin" commenced |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=9 August 2017 |accessdate=12 September 2018}}</ref> The film explores the impact of a young couple's divorce on those around them.<ref name=filming>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/26222 |title=Shooting of "Vakin Loabin" completed |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=6 November 2017}}</ref> Upon its release, received positive reviews from critics, particularly for its toned-down melodrama and departure from genre stereotypes.<ref name=VakinLoabinReview/> In a pre-premiere review by Raajje.mv, Ismail Naail Nasheed praised the character development and reduced melodrama in the film, highlighting Jumayyil's versatility in portraying a range of emotions.<ref name=VakinLoabinReview>{{cite news |url=https://raajje.mv/news/27939 |title=Pre-premiere review of Vakin Loabin: A break apart from a genre of melodrama; A must watch |language=Divehi |work=Raajje.mv |last=Nasheed |first=Ismail Naail |date=4 March 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918062119/https://raajje.mv/news/27939 |url-status=dead |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
===2019–present: Experiment with different genres=== Jumayyil's first release in 2019 was the Ahmed Sinan-directed crime thriller ''[[Goh Raalhu]]'' (2019) which delves into themes of criminality and misdemeanors as a young man strives to prove the sincerity of his love.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/32989 |title=Goh Raalhu yet again postponed |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=20 March 2018 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20190128101708/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/32989 |url-status=live |archivedate=28 January 2019 |accessdate=28 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/14230 |title=Goh Raalhu: Shinan's second direction |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=13 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20190128074915/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/14230 |url-status=live |archivedate=28 January 2019 |accessdate=28 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> It received widespread positive reviews from critics, with Aminath Luba of ''Sun'' describing it as a "five-star worthy blockbuster film" and wrote: "Jumayyil yet again proved that he is here to stay and entertain the audience with his authentic performance, no matter what the genre is".<ref name=GohRaalhuReview>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/115066 |title=Goh Raalhu Review: Drowned in the wave of Goh Raalhu |language=Divehi |work=Sun |last=Luba |first=Aminath |date=16 February 2019 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20190523164142/https://sun.mv/115066 |url-status=live |archivedate=23 May 2019 |accessdate=23 May 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Furthermore, some reviews also suggested that he excels in crime-related roles over romantic ones.<ref name=GohRaalhuReview/> This was followed by his appearance as a conflicted husband and son in [[Ali Shifau]]-directed comedy film ''[[Maamui]]''.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/35536 |title=Filming for Maamui started with Ismail Wajeeh |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=7 May 2018 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20190401184238/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/35536 |url-status=live |archivedate=1 April 2019 |accessdate=1 April 2019 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Upon its release, the film received mainly positive reviews from critics, while Jumayyil's performance was perceived by critics as "good but nothing great". Ifraz Ali from ''Dho?'' found the dialogue delivery by Jumayyil to be "unrealistic" in the film.<ref name=MaamuiRev>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/121565 |title=Maamui Review: A honey-filled laughing riot |language=Divehi |work=Sun |last=Lubaa |first=Aminath |date=11 July 2019 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20231001105610/https://sun.mv/121565 |archivedate=1 October 2023 |access-date=1 October 2023}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/57885 |title=This Maamui tastes good |language=Divehi |work=Dho? |last=Ali |first=Ifraz |date=16 July 2019 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20231001111817/https://dho.mv/baiscope/57885 |archivedate=1 October 2023 |access-date=1 October 2023}}</ref> Later in the year, the first Maldivian [[Anthology film|anthology]] film was released, featuring Jumayyil as a drug dealer in the segment directed by [[Ravee Farooq]], titled ''Gaathil''.<ref name=HHInt>{{cite news |url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/62002 |title=After a six years' gap, Hatharu Halha to release in Baiskoafu |work=Mihaaru |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=29 September 2020 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200910180054/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/62002 |url-status=live |archivedate=10 September 2020 |accessdate=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> This project, shot in 2013, was digitally released six years later due to post-production delays.<ref name=HHcont>{{cite news |url=https://avas.mv/14072 |title=Ravee on Hot seat in Hatharu Halha project |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=4 March 2016 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200911091728/https://avas.mv/14072 |url-status=live |archivedate=11 September 2020 |accessdate=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
Following controversies related to his personal life, Jumayyil experienced changes in his project lineup, with some roles being reassigned to other contemporary actors.<ref name=porn/> However, he was retained in certain films due to the progress of filming.<ref name=porn/> In 2023, Jumayyil appeared in [[Ilyas Waheed]]'s crime thriller ''[[Nina (2023 film)|Nina]]'' (2023), where he portrayed the character Zafar.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://dhuvas.mv/238046 |title=Dhivehi film "Neena" to release in August |work=Dhuvas |date=31 May 2023 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20230531102152/https://dhuvas.mv/238046 |url-status=live |archivedate=31 May 2023 |accessdate=12 August 2023 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Originally scheduled for a theatrical release in late 2020, the film was postponed due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic]].<ref name="COVID">{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/79793 |title=Release of Nina postponed due to COVID-19 |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=4 September 2020 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20210111123737/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/79793 |url-status=live|archivedate=11 January 2021 |accessdate=10 January 2021 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Upon its eventual release, the film received positive reviews from critics.<ref name=DhuvasNina/> Akram Abdulla of ''Dhauru'' praised it as a thrilling experience with commendable performances, offering an excellent cinematic experience to viewers.<ref name=DhuvasNina>{{cite news|url=https://dhauru.com/post/entertainment/20806 |title=Neena: A good film worth a watch |work=Dhauru |last=Abdulla |first=Akram |date=7 August 2023 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20230812094902/https://dhauru.com/post/entertainment/20806 |url-status=live |archivedate=12 August 2023 |accessdate=12 August 2023 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Media image== In 2018, he was ranked in the ninth position from Dho?'s list of Top Ten Actor of Maldives.<ref name=BestActor>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |title=Who is the Best Actor? |work=Dho? |language=dv |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=26 February 2018 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190106182050/https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |url-status=live |archive-date=6 January 2019 |access-date=7 February 2019|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Controversy== In December 2016, Jumayyil was under investigation on allegations of raping two of his female relatives.<ref name=porn/> The Prosecutor General's Office revealed that charges of sexual assault were not pressed against him as a result of insufficient evidence.<ref name=evidence>{{cite news|url=https://edition.mv/news/17646 |title=Actor Jumayyil prosecuted for keeping porn on phone, tablet |work=The Edition |last=Malsa |first=Mariyam |date=3 July 2020 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20200705043948/https://edition.mv/news/17646 |url-status=live |archivedate=5 July 2020 |accessdate=5 July 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Allegations regarding the sexual abuse resurfaced in July 2020 after one of the victim, aged 17 at the time of the abuse, publicly shared a detailed account of the harassment.<ref name=evidence/> As a result, production company [[Dark Rain Entertainment]] removed him from all pending projects.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://raajje.mv/81873 |title=Maldivian actor accused of rape, dropped from all pending projects |work=Raajje.mv |last=Zalif |first=Zunana |date=3 July 2020 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200820110753/https://raajje.mv/81873 |url-status=live |archivedate=20 August 2020 |accessdate=20 August 2020 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
On 18 December 2017, a case was filed against Jumayyil at Criminal Court for keeping pornographic material on his phone.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://en.sun.mv/48354 |title=Jumayyil charged with porn possession |work=Actor Jumayyil prosecuted for keeping porn on phone, tablet |date=18 April 2018 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20200820105735/https://en.sun.mv/48354 |url-status=live |archivedate=20 August 2020 |accessdate=20 August 2020 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Three months later, he was charged with possession of pornography, however, was freed on bail when summoned to court for a remand hearing.<ref name=porn>{{cite news|url=https://maldivesindependent.com/crime-2/jumayyil-charged-with-porn-possession-137565 |title=Jumayyil charged with porn possession |work=Maldives Independent |date=18 April 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20200820104951/https://maldivesindependent.com/crime-2/jumayyil-charged-with-porn-possession-137565 |url-status=live |archivedate=20 August 2020 |accessdate=20 August 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> In January 2018, Jumayyil was arrested from a cafe in Malé on suspicion of consuming and possessing alcohol.<ref name=porn/>
